newsitem.title: FRANCE: Alcatel wins trans-Atlantic cable deal.
newsitem.headline: Alcatel wins trans-Atlantic cable deal.

text.p: The big French telecommunications company Alcatel Alsthom said it won a contract worth $390 million to supply an advanced trans-Atlantic fiber-optic communications system, including two cables linking London and New York.

The contract has been awarded by Cable Co. International Ltd., a joint venture of MFS Communications Company Inc. of the United States and Cable and Wireless Plc of Britain that will build, operate and own the system.
Alcatel said in a statement that the contract was the first to be awarded to one supplier to design, manufacture and install a system comprising two separate undersea cables.
The system, including a land segment and a network management system, is scheduled for completion in 1998, Alcatel said.
The system will be able to carry broadband services such as multimedia and Internet, as well as more traditional voice and data communication services.
Alcatel won the order through its Alcatel Submarine Networks subsidiary.
